targeto.name: Targeto
targeto.description:
Mobile app for goal setting and achievement
Not yet published — development in progress
Author project: concept, UX/UI design, implementation

Description:
Targeto is my own mobile app designed for people who want to effectively plan, achieve, and track their goals while building better habits. It’s created with a focus on minimalism, clarity, and everyday usability. The app supports the user at every stage of goal realization — from planning and daily actions to regular progress summaries.

Key features:
- Create and manage goals by category (e.g. learning, work, fitness) with the ability to define custom areas.
- Daily activity tracking — users mark completed tasks, and the app continuously shows progress with percentage-based goal completion.
- Automatic push notifications.
- Progress statistics and analytics — data presented in a simple and motivating way (planned goals, completion percentage, daily activity).
- Personalisation - select a light or dark theme, and personalise notifications.
- Backup - possibility to save and load a backup copy of your data.

My role:
Full responsibility for the entire app development process — from concept, through UI design, to implementation.

quiz.name: Quiz
quiz.description:
Web application, single-choice quiz
Created as a recruitment task for MAE Multimedia Art & Education

Description:
This is a single-choice quiz web application developed as part of a recruitment assignment. The project was built according to a detailed technical specification, with a focus on simplicity, functionality, and bilingual support. The main goal was to deliver a complete and seamless quiz experience in a fixed resolution of 1920×1080px.

Key features:
- Start screen with the option to begin the quiz and switch language (PL/EN).
- Quiz questions with multiple answer options (single-choice) and a button to proceed to the next question.
- Summary screen displaying the number of correct and incorrect answers, along with a dynamic message based on the result (0–50%, 51–80%, 81–100%).
- Answer review after completing the quiz – shows both user-selected and correct answers for each question.
- Bilingual support – all content is loaded from external .json files, and the language can be changed at any time without interrupting the quiz.
- Automatic restart – after 5 minutes of inactivity, the app returns to the start screen.

My role:
Complete implementation of the task – frontend development using Angular according to technical requirements, thoughtful component structure, handling quiz logic, translations, inactivity reset, and dynamic result feedback.

wineryV2.name: Winery V2
wineryV2.description:
Mobile Assistant for Home Winemakers
This is a refreshed and improved version of my engineering thesis project
Author project: concept, UX/UI design, implementation

Description:
Winery is my original mobile application designed for home winemaking enthusiasts. It serves as a personal assistant throughout the entire wine production process – from planning and calculating ingredients to logging personal batches and tracking progress.

Key features:
- Recipes and guides – a collection of proven recipes and practical advice for both beginners and advanced winemakers.
- Winemaking calculators – automatic calculation of sugar content based on measurements.
- Step-by-step process – the app guides users through each stage of winemaking, reminding them of upcoming actions and procedures.
- Progress tracking – users can mark completed steps and see exactly where each wine is in the production process.
- Winery management – log in-progress and finished wines in one place, with options to edit entries and add personal notes.
- Custom recipes – create and save your own recipes for future use.
- Photos of batches and wines – add images to easily distinguish between different wines later on.- Personalisation - choice of light or dark theme.
- Backup - possibility to save and load a backup copy of your data.

My role:
Full responsibility for the entire development process – from concept and design, through implementation, to testing and publication.
